title: I've never seen a game where mages build health almost like a primary stat.
body:
I know mages need defense, but giving them ample health is not correct. Every mage now rushes {{item:3116}} or {{item:3027}} and continue to build health base ap items.

Mages are no longer squishy, instead they can substitute as off tanks. I think this is stupid, because they are performing the same function as an off tank.

They do damage, provide utility and soak up some damage, which is the same thing an off tanks does. There need to be a more clear line between the classes.

Mages need more unique defense items that appeal to mages and not make them off tanks.  Items that have unique actives like zhonyas where they are still squishy and appealing to assassins as kill priority.


As it stands, Assassin are ignoring mages as a primary kill, leaving them unchecked to do huge damage and provide lots of utility. If you look at any other game, mages do not build health
 
Down vote all you want, but I'm right, Mages in any other game do not build health as a priority.

replies.body:
Mages need to survive assassins with full tank builds that can outlive their burst and chunk them down.

Assassins build tank to survive back line dives --> mages build health to survive tank assassins.
It is a vicious cycle.

The problem with this post is that it's not specific enough. There are three types of mages. I'll quote from the [dev blog](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/dev-blog-classes-subclasses):

># {{champion:99}} {{champion:45}} Burst Mages

>Burst Mages aim to single out vulnerable targets by locking them down and following up with a devastating barrage of damage from range. Burst Mages struggle heavily against beefier targets who can shrug off their initial spike of damage.

>---
># {{champion:30}} {{champion:8}} Battle Mages

>Battle Mages get into the middle of the fray, seeking to wreak havoc upon the entire enemy team with their overwhelming sustained area damage. Due to their relatively short (but not melee) combat ranges and the need to burn down their opponents over time, Battle Mages have significant defensive capabilities that range from sustaining endlessly to literally defying death for a short period of time.
>---
># {{champion:101}} {{champion:115}} Artillery Mages

>Artillery Mages are the masters of range, and they leverage that advantage to whittle down their opponents over time from great distances. In turn, Artillery Mages are severely punished when enemies finally succeed in closing in on them, due to their extreme fragility and limited mobility.

**Burst and Artillery Mages shouldn't be tanky; Battle Mages should.**

**Burst Mages** are kind of like ranged assassins. The challenge for normal melee assassins in killing their target is getting close without getting cc'd. The challenge for ~~ranged assassins~~ burst mages is hitting their CC spell and getting off their combo before they get blown up. 

It says **Artillery Mages** are supposed to be squishy right in the description: "extreme fragility."

It says **Battle Mages** are supposed to be tanky in the description, as well: "significant defensive capabilities"

---

Maybe you're just seeing a lot of battle mages, and think that because it has "mage" in the title they're supposed to be squishy? I dunno.

If you want to make an argument I'll buy,

- pick out a champion (or better, a few champions)
- identify which class you think they are
   - some champs are on the line, like Viktor, who's a battle mage with some burst elements
- tell me an item build you see on that champion that makes them tankier than they are supposed to be.

Viktor is almost entirely battle mage now unless you hit a sick stuncage to get both parts of E - his burst damage with ult was nerfed intentionally to make him more of a sustained damage/skirmishing/"battle" type mage. His burst is still considerable, it's just harder to pull off since the second E damage is delayed by more now

Here's the difference between lifesteal. You need to do damage to get lifesteal, hence, and assassin can still burst you down before you get a chance to attack.

Mages however always have that health available at the start of a fight, hence they are hard to burst down making them similar to tanks

it's the tradeoff.

Mages start with high HP but have very limited tools to get it back outside of their kit (so Vlad and Swain don't count, clearly).

ADCs have lower HP but have lifesteal.

Mages are harder to burst because before they were WAY TOO EASY. You take a class that (generally) has maybe 1 slow escape or no escapes and put them in a game with Lucian and Zed, they NEED HP to survive fights, because there's no way for them to refill their HP total (aside from spamming spells with catalyst I guess...?)

Meanwhile, if Ezreal or Lucian or Graves gets engaged, they have at least 1 mobility spell with a short CD, and they have lifesteal to top them up from extra damage. As Viktor I have stuncage and Zhonya's, if I built it (and of course flash). Viktor has way less options than someone like Zed, or Ezreal, or Lucian on what to do in this scenario, and so the extra HP can help keep him alive for a few extra seconds to make that play to get out, since his only option really is to outplay his opponent.
